title: 112_s2062
content: The Act may be cited as the "Freedom from Over-Criminalization and Unjust Seizures Act of 2012" and includes provisions on criminal penalties. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 are amended to remove references to foreign laws in prohibited acts related to wildlife trafficking. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 are amended to remove references to foreign laws in prohibited acts related to wildlife trafficking, specifically in clauses (ii) and (iii) of section 4. Penalties for violations include assessments for engaging in prohibited conduct under the Act. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 have been revised to exclude foreign laws in prohibited acts concerning wildlife trafficking. Violations may result in civil penalties assessed by the Secretary, based on the market value of the wildlife involved. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 have been revised to set maximum penalties for violations, with a cap of $10,000 for certain offenses and $200,000 for others. Sections (d) and (e) have been removed. Additionally, Section 5 of the Act has been amended to address forfeiture of wildlife or plants involved in violations of Section 3. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 have been revised to set maximum penalties for violations, with a cap of $10,000 for certain offenses and $200,000 for others. Section 6 of the Act has been amended to address enforcement procedures, including the redesignation of subsections and the removal of certain sentences. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 have been revised to set maximum penalties for violations, with a cap of $10,000 for certain offenses and $200,000 for others. Section 6 of the Act has been amended to address enforcement procedures, including changes to subsections and removal of specific sentences. Amendments also include adjustments to civil penalty assessments and conforming amendments to related legislation. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 have been revised to set maximum penalties for violations, with a cap of $10,000 for certain offenses and $200,000 for others. Sections of the Marine Mammal Protection Act and the Endangered Species Act have been amended to allow the Secretary to utilize other government resources and authorities. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 have been revised to set maximum penalties for violations, with a cap of $10,000 for certain offenses and $200,000 for others. Various sections of different acts have been amended to update references to the Lacey Act. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 have been revised to update references and exceptions related to activities regulated by the Tuna Conventions Act and the Atlantic Tunas Convention Act.
